text: Flasche (Shirayuki Japanese Sake, 75 cl, datiert 2013.03) aus dem Pyongyang Shop. - Blaßgelb mit zartem Grünstich, klar. - Frischer Duft mit mild süßem Reis, milder säuerlicher Schärfe, Heu und ein wenig Alkohol. - Geschmack demgegenüber arg flach mit gekochtem Reis, etwas ruppiger Schärfe und deutlichem Alkohol. Stark fuseliger Abgang. - Zu schroff und alkoholisch, kein echter Genuß.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2014 08.02.2014, 0,75l bottle sampled @ home:
Clear straw colored, flat. Aroma is slightly sweet fruity, rice, alcohol, hay, yeast. Taste is kind of raw boozy, rice, alcohol, harsh hay, hints of licorice. Slightly medical bitterness, warming alcoholic mouthfeel. Not bad, just too plain and raw.
Bottle. Looks like water without a head. Aroma and flavour of rice and alcohol.

From 0.75l bottle @ Matbørsen. Crystal clear with an appearance that looks scary much like water. Server somewhat hot, the aroma is watery sweet, clear rice and hints of orange zest. Warming! Both on the tongue and in the throat. Alcohol, rice and a strange banana/apple sweetness. To raw. By far not the best sake Ive had. 27.10.2012

Sampled from a 1.8 liter bottle this sake poured a very pale yellow-clear. Mild tearing. The aroma is semi sweet rice, lemongrass and a hint of perfume. The flavor is semi-sweet rice, lemongrass, lemon and perfume. Medium rice and lemongrass finish. Smooth and the alcohol was well hidden. Solid.

Bottle @ Bjarnes. Pours very pale and light yellow with a greenish tone. Aroma of rice, leaves, alcohol. Taste is sweet with rice, overboiled vegetables, light alcohol. Thin bodied, lightly warming alcohol in the finish. 040612
Bottle. Clear colour with no head. Aroma is sweet, alcohol, rice, yeast, fusel. Flavour is sweet, alcohol, rice, fusel. Weak, but nothing is wrong.

Bottle. Pours clear still seethrough. Aroma of alcohol, some fruity rice notes, some faint strawberries and yeast.
Flavor is sweet and alcoholic with some fruitiness and berries. Medium body . Kinda hot and aloholic.

750 ml bottle. Body is almost clear as water and a bit oily, no head. Aroma is alcohol, fusel and a faint scent of marzipan, feels sweet in aroma. Flavor is sweet and alcoholic with a hint of harsh bitterness. Behind the alcoholic flavor the body feels more soft and almost chewy in palate. More fruity in aftertaste. A bit rough in style but not bad.

Bottle, 75cl. A clear one, flat and quite oily. Slighlty alcoholic on the nose, with cooked rice and somethng earthy. That goes for the flavor too, to me its too rough. Cooked rice, earth, mold and a little citrusy touch. Lightly oily, warming and sort of smooth on the palate, with a warming finish. Not bad in any way, just too plain, rough and boring. 120124

Bottle 750ml @ gunnfryd
Pours almost clear as water. Aroma has notes of rice, fusel and marzipan. Taste is light to medium sweet and alcoholic with a very hot alcoholic finish. Body is thin and texture is watery.
75 cL bottle. Pours pale yellow with no head. Aroma is rice, earthy and slight nutty dry. Thick. Caramelish and sweet sticky rice. Sweet, thick and dense finish.

Bottle 75 cl. Courtesy of Theis. Pours almost crystal clear with a slight tint of yellow. Rough skewed aroma of I dunno really what. Medium body, skunky and skewed, sulphurous. Boozy finish. Very poor. 250711
Slightly yellow clear liquid, with no head. Aroma of fruit, leather and boiled rice. Sweet rice flavour with strong alcoholic notes
Bottle at home - Tasting. Clear light light yellow - no head. Minerals, cedar, wooden, rice, alcoholic. Classic ..... ok.
Bottle shared by Anker. Pours pale yellow. Aroma is sweet rice and alcohol. The flavour is quite alcoholic with notes of sweet rice and light fruit.
Bottle at Theis and Mettes. Clear pale pale yellow. Smells cheesy. Sweet and dry. Light bodied. Some berries and sushi rice. Dry, alci finish.

Bottle 750ml.Clear cristal clear water color with virtually none head. Aroma is moderate rice, floral, light alcohol. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet with a average duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is flat, finish feel is light to moderate alcoholic. [20100904]
rice aroma,clear color,light sweetness, lightly bitter, salty, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, bitter finish.
White and clear. No head. Aroma is heavy sweet malt, grain and perhaps roasted. Flavor is moderate sweet. Long duration. Syrupy texture. Flat carbonation.
clear body, still as one would expect.  Aroma of yeast and alcohol.  Sweet body with a yeasty finish.  Almost candy like.

Huge 1.8L bottle. Listed as Shirayuki Dry. Clear body, strong legs. Banana and a lot of alcohol in the aroma. Strong alcohol taste, like vodka and sweet rice. Thin mouhtfeel for the ABV. Good for $14 for a 1.8L, not nearly as bad as I had expected. Used for Sake Bombs last night.
Aroma is heavy alcoholik. Apperance is virtually none. Body colour is like clear water. Light sweet flavor. Light to medium, creamy palate.
Bottle. Looks like water with no head. This taste like water with alcohol.

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2009 absulutely rubish. Bad awfull flavor. ugly aroma and colour. More delicate notes in dishwash-water. Why I brouhgt this to my friends I still cant understand. Did you get it? Dont buy it.
SAKE is something else, the longing of snaps is an overall impression, so the state of beer is out...
Cold... No dont do that... better warm I hope... Terrible flavor, aroma and everything....
Bottle. Clear colour with absolute no head. Alcoholic aroma. Sweetish flavour. At least it a rating.
Bottle. No head. Clear like water. Aroma and taste are rice and alcohol. Sweet finish.
a bit too raw for me. taste seems too much plain alcohol than a decent sake. a bit over sweet. just not what Im looking for.
The aroma is ricey and sweet with alcohol. The appearance is clear. The flavor is like the aroma. The palate is watery. This is just a regular sake however it has no faults to speak of.

Bottle- served hot.  When poured, noticed heavy alcohol aroma, underlying aromas were knocked out because of it.  No oil noticed when poured.  Hits the mouth kind of dry- my mouth wanted water after a few sips, not from it being hot, but from a drying effect.  Was drinkable when warm and hot, but not as it cooled down.  Let down.

Bottle. Clear colour. Aroma of strong sweet alcoholic fruit. Flavour is bitter, metalicish and strong in alcohol ending with strange dry finish. Drinkable sake but far from the real quality ones. Sadly this is the only mainstream sake available in Denmark.

New Leaf Market, Tallahassee, Fl. - 750 ml bottle - served chilled. Pours almost clear with a slight glint. Aroma is sulphur-like with hints of overripe fruit - slightly unpleasant. Flavor is sweet and verging on cloying. Some burnt rice, alcohol and sweet kids cereal make their presence known. Mouthfeel,while somewhat thick, is kind of oily and overall it is difficult to swallow. Not one of the better sakes I have had. My bottle says it is from Australia.

it might just be me, but this has a rotten aroma. Clear-coloured body. The start is sweet like rotten fruit, then it clears up - just to disappear. Luckily. It leaves a long disgusting aftertaste, though, with metallic notes and something like bitter hints. Glad I tried it - now I can go around it in the future.
Clear watery colour with no head. Sour soapy aroma with a strong alcohol note. Awfull chemical flavor with a stong alcohol finish.
Bottle. Water colour with no head. Glue aroma and a alcoholic dusty glue taste. Medium body with a light dry finish. Yak!!!

First of all thank to Buck Dich for helping me sort out the style of this sake I picked up in my local supermarket, and secondly for entering it.It is a very light yellow sake, with a nose, that is very sharp alcoholic combined with rice. A very simple aroma, and not very inviting. The flavor is much milder and more pleasant, with notes of rice combined with light floral notes. This is to date the worst sake Ive rated - and is like the sakes I remember from my younger days, when tried them - and that doesnt invite You to explore the realm of sake - too bad that this is exported.
